result.execSummary:
The defendant Westly M Billon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will maintain absolute sobriey.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed. 

DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

DE will have 29 days credit if revoked.

2022GF79 was consolidated into 2022CF92.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

supervisions.notes: Probation corrected to 1 year per DOC letter dated 10/28/22

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Westly M Billon

records.addlTxt: 10/28/22 Letter form DOC to Judge Wickstrom
DNA Order
DE has indicated undecided about seeking PCR

10:16 AM Defendant Westly M Billon appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Westly M Billon.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 22CF16, 22CF92. 10:17am Atty would like a break out room with his client. 10:32 Back on the record.  Atty recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 1 in 22CF16 and Ct's 2, 3 in 22CF92.  Court has colloquy with DE on his right to personal appearance, DE will waive his right to personal appearance, court accepts.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty. DE will waive the right to a PSI.

22CF16-Ct 1  Withhold sentence, 3 years probation. DE will complete an AODA and complete any follow up treatment recommended, maintain absolute sobriety of drugs/alcohol, pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge. Credit of 30 days if revoked.

22CF92-Ct's 2,3.  Withhold sentence, 3 years probation. DE will complete an AODA and complete any follow up treatment recommended, maintain absolute sobriety of drugs and alcohol, pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.  DE does have a bed date of October 24.  Court will accept the recommended sentence. Credit of 29 days if revoked.  Court wishes DE all the best on his road to recovery. Adj 10:43am.
Review hearing on October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:32 PM Defendant Westly M Billon not in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Westly M Billon. Heard along with 22CF16, 22CF92.  DE appeared earlier via ZOOM.  Reset cases to August 23, 2022 @ 10:00AM.
Review hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:02 PM  Prosecuting attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Westly M Billon appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Westly M Billon. Cases 22CF92 and 22CF16 heard together.  22CF92 set for PH.  DE waived PH.  DE understood his rights.   Court reviewed CC and found factual basis to bind DE over for trial.  INFO filed this date.  ARGN held.  DE entered a NG plea.    22CF16 set for RH.        Both cases set for RH 8/2/22 at 1:30 PM.  Adj. 3:07 PM
Certified bond from 2022CF16 (GF Bond)
Certified bond from Barron County
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. Any cash bond posted for Defendant shall be used for fines, costs and restitution pursuant to WI STAT 969.13(5)

4:18 PM Defendant Westly M Billon in court via Zoom from RD Jail.   Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Westly M Billon.  Waive formal reading of the CC. Atty would like to address the issue of bond, sanction will be up on Wednesday, will be on electonic monitoring, living with his grandmother in Chetek, asking the court for a reasonable cash bond.  The State does not object to reduction of cash bond, asks for a $200.00 cash bond.  The court will order a $200.00 cash bond.  DE/Atty will waive TL for PH. Court instructs on waiver of TL, DE understands, court will accept waiver of TL.  Set for PH May 17, 2022 @ 3:00PM. Adj 4:23pm.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
